p: nCOVID-19 patients exhibit various clinical symptoms including cough, fever, fatigue, radiographic evidence of pneumonia, dyspnea, decreased or normal leukocyte counts, and myalgia (Huang et al., 2020). These aforesaid symptoms are also similar to MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV infections (Peiris et al., 2004). Even though nCOVID-19 pathogenesis is not well-understood, however the similar mechanisms used previously by MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV can provide a lot of information regarding SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis ( Figure 1).
